questions.question_text: If an arriving aircraft is making a straight in approach a departing aircraft may take off in any direction
options: Until five minutes before the arriving aircraft is estimated to be over the Instrument runway
Until ten minutes before the arriving aircraft is estimated to be over the Instrument runway
Until two minutes before the arriving aircraft is estimated to be over the Instrument runway

questions.question_text: For controlled traffic that shall be separated in the vicinity of an airport, separation minima may be reduced:
options: At the discretion of the air traffic controller
When the commander in the following aircraft has the preceding aircraft in sight and is able to maintain own separation
If the commander of the involved aircraft so requests

questions.question_text: At the commencement of final approach, if the controller possesses wind Information in the form of components, significant changes in the mean surface wind direction and speed shall be transmitted to aircraft. The mean tall-wind component significant change is:
options: 3kt
4kt
2kt

questions.question_text: The EAT has to be transmitted to the pilot as soon as possible, in case the expected delay is:
options: 5 minutes or more
15 minutes or more
20 minutes

questions.question_text: A so called "Visual Approach" can be performed:
options: During VFR flight, there should be a visibility of 5km or more
During IFR flights, if the cloudbase is 1000ft more than the appropriate DA or MDA for that procedure
During IFR flights, if there is permanent sight on the movement area and the underlying ground

questions.question_text: "Time Approach Procedure" is used as necessary to expedite the approach of a number of arriving aircraft. This will be obtained requesting aircraft:
options: To maintain a specified speed during the approach procedure
To pass the specified point inbound at the previously notified time
To apply a step down descent between aircraft in the approach sequence

questions.question_text: During an arrival procedure under an IFR flight plan in VMC conditions, traffic avoidance is the responsibility of:
options: The radar controller
The pilot in command
The approach controller

questions.question_text: If the crew on an arriving aircraft approaching a controlled aerodrome will report "field in sight", a clearance for "visual approach" may be given under certain conditions
options: The meteorological visibility must not be less than 8km
The approach must be passing the FAF
The air traffic controller will provide separation to other controlled traffic

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct? During a "visual approach" in controlled airspace (class C):
options: ATC will apply separation with other traffic
The pilot has to apply separation with other traffic
ATC will apply separation with other arriving traffic

questions.question_text: One minute separation may be used between departing aircraft if they are to fly on tracks divering by atleast:
options: $30^{\circ}$ immediately after take-off
$15^{\circ}$ immediately after take-off
$45^{\circ}$ immediately after take-off
